contentrichtext.text: '''Viscount Southwell''', of Castle Mattress in the County of [[Limerick]], is a title in the [[Peerage of Ireland]].<ref>{{London Gazette| issue = 11679 | startpage = 1 | date = 29 June 1776 | accessdate = 11 June 2009 }}</ref> It was created in 1776 for [[Thomas Southwell, 1st Viscount Southwell|Thomas Southwell, 3rd Baron Southwell]]. The Southwell family descends from Thomas Southwell. In 1662 he was created a '''Baronet''', of Castle Mattress in the County of Limerick, in the [[Baronetage of Ireland]]. He was succeeded by his son, the second Baronet. He represented [[Limerick County (Parliament of Ireland constituency)|Limerick County]] in the Irish Parliament. In 1717 he was created '''Baron Southwell''', of Castle Mattress, in the County of Limerick, in the Peerage of Ireland.<ref>{{London Gazette| issue = 5565 | startpage = 1 | date = 17 August 1717 | accessdate = 10 June 2009 }}</ref> His grandson was the aforementioned third Baron, who was elevated to a viscountcy in 1776. Before succeeded in the barony he had represented [[Enniscorthy (Parliament of Ireland constituency)|Enniscorthy]] in the [[Irish House of Commons]]. His great-grandson, the fourth Viscount, served as [[Lord Lieutenant of Leitrim|Lord Lieutenant of County Leitrim]] between 1872 and 1878. {{As of|2010}} the titles are held by his great-grandson, the seventh Viscount, who succeeded his uncle in 1960. The family surname and the title of the peerages, Southwell, is pronounced "Suthell". ==Southwell Baronets, of Castle Mattress (1662)== *Sir Thomas Southwell, 1st Baronet (d. 1680) *[[Thomas Southwell, 1st Baron Southwell|Sir Thomas Southwell, 2nd Baronet]] (1665–1720) (created '''Baron Southwell''' in 1717) ==Barons Southwell (1717)== *[[Thomas Southwell, 1st Baron Southwell]] (1665–1720) *[[Thomas Southwell, 2nd Baron Southwell]] (1698–1766) *[[Thomas Southwell, 1st Viscount Southwell|Thomas George Southwell, 3rd Baron Southwell]] (1721–1780) (created '''Viscount Southwell''' in 1776) ==Viscounts Southwell (1776)== *[[Thomas George Southwell, 1st Viscount Southwell]] (1721–1780) *[[Thomas Arthur Southwell, 2nd Viscount Southwell]] (1742–1796) *[[Thomas Southwell, 3rd Viscount Southwell|Thomas Anthony Southwell, 3rd Viscount Southwell]] (1777–1860) *[[Thomas Southwell, 4th Viscount Southwell|Thomas Arthur Joseph Southwell, 4th Viscount Southwell]] (1836–1878) *Arthur Robert Pyers Southwell, 5th Viscount Southwell (1872–1944) *Robert Arthur William Joseph Southwell, 6th Viscount Southwell (1898–1960) *Pyers Anthony Joseph Southwell, 7th Viscount Southwell (b. 1930) The [[heir apparent]] is the present holder's son the Hon. Richard Andrew Pyers Southwell (b. 1956) == Notes == {{Reflist}} == References == *Kidd, Charles, Williamson, David (editors). ''Debrett's Peerage and Baronetage'' (1990 edition). New York: St Martin's Press, 1990, {{Page needed |date=February 2013}} *{{Rayment|date=February 2012}} {{British viscounts}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Southwell}} [[Category:Viscountcies in the Peerage of Ireland]]
